intro: Cordia wickstroemii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by oval, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
